did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Official map number one of Victoria, VA, Lunenburg Co., 1915 (1926)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lunenburg County (Va.) Official map number one of Victoria, VA, Lunenburg Co., 1915 (1926). Local government records collection, Lunenburg County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from Lunenburg County under the accession number 43198.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Lunenburg County was named for George II, duke of Brunswick-Luneburg, a German possession of the Hanoverian kings of England. It was formed from Brunswick County in 1745.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Official map number one of Victoria, VA, Lunenburg Co., compiled and drawn by A. D. Kaylor, January 20, 1915. Revised and traced by C. L. Smith, April 27, 1926. Shows town of Victoria, Virginia, from 15th Street and Bragg estate, to county road to Kenbridge; Forest Avenue to Lunenburg Lumber Company land. Includes streets, lot numbers, railroad tracks and roundhouse, cemeteries, schools, and some landowner names.

controlaccess.head: Genre and Form Terms:
